radial_build.documentation: Radial build of the center stack

radial_build.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

radial_build.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

radial_build.code.library[:].parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

radial_build.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

radial_build.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

radial_build.oh_b_field_max.documentation: Maximum OH magnetic field at the center of the solenoid

radial_build.tf_b_field_max.documentation: Maximum TF magnetic field at the vacuum vessel center

radial_build.layer.documentation: List of layers in the center stack

radial_build.layer[:].start_radius.documentation: Start radius of the layer layer

radial_build.layer[:].end_radius.documentation: End radius of the layer layer

radial_build.layer[:].type.documentation:
Center-stack type code
0) vacuum (use this to set mimimum radius for OH)
1) OH
2) TF
3) BL
4) Shielding
5) Wall
-1) Vacuum vessel

radial_build.layer[:].identifier.documentation: Integer to identify the same layer on the high-field-side and low-field-side

radial_build.layer[:].hfs.documentation: Integer set to -1 if layer is on the high-field-side and 1 if layer is on the low-field-side. 0 when not applicable (eg. vessel, OH, and cryostat)

radial_build.layer[:].outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the limiting surface. Do NOT repeat the first point for closed contours

radial_build.pf_coils_rail.documentation: List of rails where the PF coils can slide on

radial_build.pf_coils_rail[:].name.documentation: Name of the pf coil rail

radial_build.pf_coils_rail[:].coils_numb.documentation: Number of coils on the rail

radial_build.pf_coils_rail[:].outline.documentation: Irregular (possibly not-continuous) outline of the rail surface

radial_build.pf_coils_rail[:].outline.di.documentation: Distance along the rail skipping gaps

radial_build.tf.coils_n.documentation: Number of coils around the torus

radial_build.tf.thickness.documentation: Toroidal Thickness of the TF coils

radial_build.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

radial_build.ids_properties.comment.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

radial_build.ids_properties.creation_dat.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

radial_build.ids_properties.homogeneous_.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

radial_build.ids_properties.occurrence.description: occurrence number [NOTE: this field only exists in OMAS and is not part of the ITER PDM]

radial_build.ids_properties.provider.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

radial_build.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...)

radial_build.ids_properties.version_put.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS

radial_build.ids_properties.version_put..documentation: Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS
